bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 145 (Friday, September 9, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WENSTRUP:H.R. 8799.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution[Page H7742]

item.title: Otto Warmbier Countering North Korean Censorship and Surveillance Act of 2021

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

summary.text:
Otto Warmbier Countering North Korean Censorship and Surveillance Act of 2021

This bill authorizes sanctions related to censorship in North Korea and addresses related issues.

The President may impose property-blocking sanctions on foreign individuals and entities responsible for implementing or facilitating North Korea's censorship laws and surveillance. For the individuals that meet such criteria, the President may also impose visa-blocking sanctions.

The bill also authorizes the U.S. Agency for Global Media to provide increased broadcasting and grants for various purposes, including the development of internet freedom tools to facilitate information sharing related to North Korea and the restoration of the agency's broadcasting capacity to North Korea. 

The President must submit to Congress a strategy to combat North Korea's information environment. The Department of State and the Department of the Treasury must jointly report to Congress each year on U.S. government activities related to the enforcement of sanctions against North Korea.

bill.title: Otto Warmbier Countering North Korean Censorship and Surveillance Act of 2021

item.title: Otto Warmbier Countering North Korean Censorship and Surveillance Act of 2021
Otto Warmbier Countering North Korean Censorship and Surveillance Act of 2021
To promote freedom of information and counter censorship and surveillance in North Korea, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
